intro: Rhynchosia pallida var. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian burr legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its unique feature is the presence of hooked, spiny pods that aid in seed dispersal by clinging to animal fur. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
